ygData.subject: The great beyond...
ygData.msgSnippet: Computer: Warning. We are approaching the wormhole. Auto pilot now disengages. And there it was. From afar, the wormhole was an amazing thing, almost not

Computer: Warning. We are approaching the wormhole. Auto pilot now 
disengages.

And there it was. From afar, the wormhole was an amazing thing, almost 
not visible without instruments. Yet, the constant slight deformation 
of the visible stars showed there was something after all.

Yggdrasil Prime did not want to take time to wonder about that 
though. To him, it was merely a useless distraction, not any kind of 
wonderful natural phenomenon. He had been sent on a priority mission 
and he was not going to scrap it away at the last moment.

He took control of the ship and gradually increased the speed. He then 
turned the neutron emittor on.

Wormholes were a complex thing. They could lead to millions of 
different places if one was not careful. However, a predacon 
researcher once discovered that the destination was predetermined by 
the neutron flow of a ship's engines, among other variables. The 
Bullet id not emit enough, so it used a neutron emittor to bring its 
level to the same one as that of the ships it pursued.

Yggdrasil entered the wormhole and gripped the controls as good as he 
could.

Soon afterwards, he was in the Solar System.
